content.description: Same start as High on Fungi.  Climb straight up from the sit start on small crimps to the top out.

This is arguably the best problem in the canyon. Sit/campus start on the right side on two good pockets. After a campus move or two, move out left to the two good jugs, from there throw up to a sloper rail on the face. Traverse left then  either dyno or reach high for an obvious pocket (crux) then climb straight up and top out.
content.location: Right side of Mushroom beginning on the good pockets down low.    To get down, easily scramble down the backside of Mushroom.

content.description: Use starting crimp rail of Bloody Shnidbit, from there explode out directly vertical to top out. One powerful move, short but sweet.

Start matched on the undercling of Bloody Schnidbit low.  Climb through Bloody Schnidbit but instead of exiting at the end of the face, continue around the corner to top out just left of the finish of High on Fungi in the shallow dihedral.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter to make it move.

content.description: Start way low under the aret bulge that is the start of Bloody Shnidbit but crawl down inside the big hueco for an undercling sloper start. The first three moves into Bloody Shnidbit are hard and they make the entire problem complete. This is a must do problem!
content.protection: several pads moved along the problem by spotters
content.location:
Locate the start rail for Bloody Shnidbit, crawl down below into the hueco for a lowball sit start. 

  Jump off the back

content.description: This fine line is an excellent traverse problem. It is a great route for people who aren't quite up for High on Fungi.
content.protection: A traveling boulder pad and a spotter to make it travel..
content.location: This route is located on the far left side of Mushroom Boulder. Sit start low on good holds. Traverse up and right around to top out on the face of the boulder.

content.description: Located in the beautiful Aoudad Valley, Mushroom boulder is probably the best the canyon has to offer for a variety of reasons. Though not the most easily accessed, Mushroom offers a secluded getaway out of view from the road. The rock on Mushroom is very hard and some of the best in the canyon. Several routes of varying difficulty make it a great place for groups of all ability levels. While the almost treeless valley allows even the most novice photographer some spectacular opportunities as well.
